website_summaries.verdict: Buoyant but very stable, these skis will have kids clamoring to have another turn water-skiing.
pros: Designed for smaller, younger skiers with an extra-wide front and parabolic shape
cons: Kids may grow out of the binders quickly

customer_reviews.title: NO STABILIZER BAR
customer_reviews.text: The skis look fine, but even tough description says “includes stabilizer bar” - it does NOT. That was an important feature and primarily why I selected this product - and it isn’t available separately on Amazon. I had to order from another vendor and disappoint the kids that are waiting to ski - instead we will wait for an additional shipment. Thank you Amazon for covering the cost. Triple thumbs down to the vendor’s incorrect description.
customer_reviews.author: Pgh Parent

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: i have been teaching friends and family to ski for DECADES and these are the best thing I have come across. Makes it a piece of cake. Truly. Great skiis. You need to tighten the bar overtime before you go again. I ordered a replacement ahead of time from Barts water sports just in case. You can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Kay

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the beginner
customer_reviews.text: Excellent skies for a beginner. My son is 11 and gets right up on them. The stabilization bar is a perfect training aid to help keep skies straight.
customer_reviews.author: Jmar

customer_reviews.title: Skis that can grow with the kids
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for the kids and because I can't use them, all I can say is that my 9 & 11 year old kids (boy/girl respectively) learned two weeks ago on old wooden Disney Popsicle stick trainers with tiny rudders and no contouring on the bottom and the next week shot right out of the water on these and cruised steadily around the lake. The bottom is contoured differently than skis I used years ago but the kids looked rock-solid behind the boat and, in fact, my daughter popped right out of the water on a deep start after a crash on her first try--made us proud!
customer_reviews.author: Dan Ayd

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: We just used these with our grandchildren and both boys got up. What is so nice is keeping both skis together until they get leg control.
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: Ok but difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: The skis are difficult to put on because the adjustment buttons stick. The training bracket will not stay tight and has to be retightened after every fall. They are bit annoying to use to be honest.
customer_reviews.author: Honeman

customer_reviews.title: These skis were beginner suitable for an athletic 7 Yr old female newbie.
customer_reviews.text: 7 Yr old Granddaughter got up on her second try. The product performed as expected, and so did Granddaughter for her inaugural try.
customer_reviews.author: T. C. Dorch

customer_reviews.title: Stabilizer Bar Broke 1st Time We Used!
customer_reviews.text: Plastic stabilizer bar broke literally the very first time we took our 10 year old son out on the water. What a terrible design idea, it should be something flexible like rubber instead of hard, brittle plastic. To make matters worse, I tried emailing the seller but Amazon said there's something wrong with the email address so I can't even contact them. So, so very disappointing for $200 water skis!
customer_reviews.author: AnonymousZ

customer_reviews.title: Great skis except...
customer_reviews.text: Great widebody skis however boots are so little you have to use next size up skis when you reach size 7-8 and those longer skis are too big until you reach 13-14yrs old. Didn't want to buy 3 sets of skis. Was hoping to just have two sets. Probably is something in the middle.
customer_reviews.author: william

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner skis
customer_reviews.text: Great skis for the price, got one new kid up this year on them. But holding cross bar is hard to get right enough to not work loose and fall out
customer_reviews.author: Ainjylface

customer_reviews.title: Nice Beginner Skis & With Slalom Capability
customer_reviews.text: These skis work very well for a 10 yr old boy. Advantage is that they’re also slalom capable.
customer_reviews.author: Blonde Lady

customer_reviews.title: They are as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I think the skies work great. I am teaching my 8 & 9 year old grand kids ho
customer_reviews.author: boogerred1

customer_reviews.title: Damaged ski
customer_reviews.text: The end of the ski was chipped when I removed from packing. My grandkids were here & excited to ski & I didn’t want to send them back while they were visiting. Then I noticed that they AR cracked where the screws go into the foot piece. I would like t replace
customer_reviews.author: Lois Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Great junior trainer skis!
customer_reviews.text: Skis are great for my daughters and teaching their friends to ski. I love the ease of removing the toe brace and that one ski has the back slide for learning to slalom.
customer_reviews.author: Rye Myers

customer_reviews.title: Super fun
customer_reviews.text: I’m a 5’6” 120lb adult that wears a women’s size 6. These are perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Dayna Cramer

customer_reviews.title: works for everyone
customer_reviews.text: Great for bigger beginners and kids that are more experienced.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great For 1st Time Skiers
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to teach my 6 year old grandson & 8 year old granddaughter to ski. They each got up on their 1st time and are having a blast skiing this summer.
customer_reviews.author: pop2010

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner skis
customer_reviews.text: These skis are well-designed for learning to ski and will serve well also after removing the connector. I totally recommend them
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Ewing

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners
customer_reviews.text: My grandson got up right away in these skis. He was so excited.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie in Louisiana

customer_reviews.title: High quality product, good beginner tool.
customer_reviews.text: Skiis work very well for teaching a new person to ski. Pay attention to weight limit, it is difficult to get up if over weight limit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these skies
customer_reviews.text: Great skies. My 11 year old learned to ski on these
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell Heffron

product_meta.title: O'Brien Jr Vortex Widebody 54" Combo Water Skis
product_meta.description: A great choice for the junior skier, the O'Brien Jr. Vortex is designed with an extra wide forebody and a parabolic shape for easy deep water starts. Stabilizer bar provides an easier pull. Dual density junior adjustable bindings fit kids' size 2 - men's size 7. For skiers up to 140 lbs. Length: 54 inch.
feature_bullets: Jr. X-7 adjustable bindings (one ski has rear toe piece)

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
